content.description: Stand start with a left hand on the shallow arête and a right hand on a crimp about 5 feet off the deck.  From there, work up the slab using the right hand crimps and the left on the juggy arête. Top it out slightly to the left using the large ledge.
content.protection: A pad or two, the landing is great though.
content.location:
On the far eastern side of the slabby north face of Anchor Block, this climbs just to the left of

Channel Orange

.

content.description:
This is a fun slab problem with a committing finish.

Stand start with hands on opposing sidepulls.  From there, climb a series of crimps, once to the upper crimp, match hands, and stand tall (crux) to the large ledge and top it out.  The final moves to the lip may incorporate a series of tough pinches, versus the more dynamic move. I don't think it would affect the problem's grade however.

Once topped out, you can either walk the ledge out left and climb down the east face, or jump back down.
content.protection: A pad or two, great landing though.
content.location: This is near the middle of Anchor Block's north-facing slab.

content.description: Climb up the right side of the south face.

Stand start with hands staggered on the crimps about 5 feet off the deck.  From there, work up the slab using the crimps, then reach the good rail and ledge for a solid topout.

The first move off the ground is the most difficult as it requires some quick and accurate footwork.

Essentially the same problem as

Sunbather

, it avoids using the arête though.
content.protection: A pad or two, great landing though.
content.location:
It is on the easternmost side of Anchor Block's north face, just to the right of

Sunbather

.

content.description: Climb up the lengthy center of the south face.

Oohhh, don't cha know this here's just a doozy of a route! Have yerself a ball grabbin' and a wrigglin' all up in the ol' anchors behind, kinda like my doctor did last Thursday. Come out gasping for air in the widening OW at the top!
content.protection: Should she fart ye off, bring a pad or two for the terrible rocky landing.
content.location: It is on the West face of Anchor Block.

content.description: Climb up the good holds on the left side of the south face.
